In Class Exercise 3

Toh Jun Long

8/31/2021

packages = c('sf', 'tmap', 'tidyverse')
for (p in packages){
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)){
    install.packages(p)
  }
  library(p,character.only = T)
}

popdata = read_csv("Hands-on_Ex03/data/aspatial/respopagesextod2011to2020.csv")
## Rows: 984656 Columns: 7
## -- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
## Delimiter: ","
## chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
## dbl (2): Pop, Time
## 
## i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

## 10 Ang Mo Kio Ang Mo Kio Town Centre 0_to_4 Females HDB 3-Room Flats    10  2011
## # ... with 984,646 more rows
popdata2020 = popdata %>% 
  filter(Time == 2020) %>% 
  group_by(PA,SZ,AG) %>% 
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  pivot_wider(names_from = AG,
              values_from = POP) %>% 
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         + rowSums(.[12])) %>% 
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:11]) +
         rowSums(.[13:15])) %>% 
mutate(`AGED` = rowSums(.[16:21])) %>% 
mutate(`TOTAL` = rowSums(.[3:21])) %>% 
mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)/`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>% 
  select(`PA`,`SZ`,`YOUNG`,`ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, `TOTAL`,`DEPENDENCY`)
## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
popdata2020
## # A tibble: 332 x 7
##    PA         SZ                     YOUNG `ECONOMY ACTIVE`  AGED TOTAL DEPENDENCY
##    <chr>      <chr>                  <dbl>            <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
##  1 Ang Mo Kio Ang Mo Kio Town Centre  1290             2760   760  4810      0.743
##  2 Ang Mo Kio Cheng San               5640            16460  6050 28150      0.710
##  3 Ang Mo Kio Chong Boon              5100            15000  6470 26570      0.771
##  4 Ang Mo Kio Kebun Bahru             4620            13010  5120 22750      0.749
##  5 Ang Mo Kio Sembawang Hills         1880             3630  1310  6820      0.879
##  6 Ang Mo Kio Shangri-La              3330             9050  3610 15990      0.767
##  7 Ang Mo Kio Tagore                  1940             4480  1530  7950      0.775
##  8 Ang Mo Kio Townsville              4190            11950  5100 21240      0.777
##  9 Ang Mo Kio Yio Chu Kang               0                0     0     0    NaN    
## 10 Ang Mo Kio Yio Chu Kang East       1110             2410   750  4270      0.772
## # ... with 322 more rows
popdata2020 = popdata2020 %>% 
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA,SZ),
            .funs = funs(toupper)) %>% 
  filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE`> 0)
## Warning: `funs()` was deprecated in dplyr 0.8.0.
## Please use a list of either functions or lambdas: 
## 
##   # Simple named list: 
##   list(mean = mean, median = median)
## 
##   # Auto named with `tibble::lst()`: 
##   tibble::lst(mean, median)
## 
##   # Using lambdas
##   list(~ mean(., trim = .2), ~ median(., na.rm = TRUE))
mpsz_pop2020 = left_join(mpsz, popdata2020,
                         by = c('SUBZONE_N' = "SZ"))
aged_quantile = tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons("AGED",
              style = "quantile",
              palette = "Blues")
aged_equal = tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons("AGED",
              style = "equal",
              palette = "Blues")+
  tm_layout(legend.height = 0.45,
            legend.width = 5.0,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE)
tmap_arrange(aged_quantile,aged_equal,asp = 1, ncol = 2)

ggplot(data = mpsz_pop2020,
       aes(x = "", y = AGED))+
  geom_boxplot()
## Warning: Removed 92 rows containing non-finite values (stat_boxplot).

mpszpop2020a = mpsz_pop2020 %>% 
  drop_na()
percent_bin <- c(0,.01,.1,.5,.9,.99,1)
var = mpszpop2020a["DEPENDENCY"] %>%
  st_set_geometry(NULL)
get.var = function(vname, df) {
  v = df[vname] %>% 
    st_set_geometry(NULL)
  v = unname(v[,1])
  return(v)
}
var = get.var("DEPENDENCY",mpszpop2020a)
bperc = quantile(var,percent_bin)
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_polygons()+
tm_shape(mpszpop2020a)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          title = "DEPENDENCY",
          breaks = bperc,
          palette = "Blues",
          labels = c("<1%", "1% - 10%", "10% - 50%","50% - 90%", "90% - 99%", ">99%")) +
  tm_borders()+
  tm_layout(title = "Percentile Map",
            title.position = c("right", "bottom"))

percentmap = function(vnam, df, legtitle = NA, mtitle = "Percentile Map") {
  percent_bin <- c(0,.01,.1,.5,.9,.99,1)
  var = get.var(vnam,df)
bperc = quantile(var,percent_bin)
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_polygons()+
tm_shape(df)+
  tm_fill(vnam,
          title = legtitle,
          breaks = bperc,
          palette = "Blues",
          labels = c("<1%", "1% - 10%", "10% - 50%","50% - 90%", "90% - 99%", ">99%")) +
  tm_borders()+
  tm_layout(title = mtitle, title.position = c("right", "bottom"))
}
youngmap = percentmap("YOUNG", mpszpop2020a)
agedmap = percentmap("AGED", mpszpop2020a)
tmap_arrange(youngmap,agedmap,asp = 1, ncol = 2)

boxbreaks = function(v, multiplier = 1.5) {
  qv = unname(quantile(v))
  iqr = qv[4] - qv[2]
  upperfence = qv[4] + multiplier * iqr
  lowerfence = qv[2] - multiplier * iqr
  bb = vector(mode = "numeric", length = 7)
  if (lowerfence <qv[1]){
    bb[1] = lowerfence
    bb[2] = floor(qv[1])
  } else {
    bb[2] = lowerfence
    bb[1] = qv[1]
  }
  if (upperfence > qv[5]){
    bb[7] = upperfence
    bb[6] = ceiling(qv[5])
  } else {
    bb[7] = qv[5]
    bb[6] = upperfence
  }
  bb[3:5] = qv[2:4]
  return(bb)
}
mpszpop2020a = mpsz_pop2020 %>% 
  filter(AGED >=0)
var = get.var("AGED",mpszpop2020a)
quantile(var)
##    0%   25%   50%   75%  100% 
##     0   515  2080  3745 20240
boxbreaks(var)
## [1] -4330     0   515  2080  3745  8590 20240
boxmap <- function(vnam, df, legtitle= NA, mtitle = "Box Map", multiplier = 1.5) {
  var <- get.var(vnam, df)
  bb = boxbreaks(var)
  tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
    tm_polygons()+
  tm_shape(df) +
    tm_fill(vnam,
            title = legtitle,
            breaks = bb,
            palette = "Blues",
            labels =  c("lower outlier",
                        "< 25%",
                        "25% - 50%",
                        "50% - 75%",
                        "> 75%",
                        "upper outlier")) +
  tm_borders()+
  tm_layout(title = mtitle,
            title.position = c("right","bottom"))
}
boxmap("ECONOMY ACTIVE",mpszpop2020a)
## Warning: Breaks contains positive and negative values. Better is to use
## diverging scale instead, or set auto.palette.mapping to FALSE.

mpszpop2020a <- mpsz_pop2020 %>% 
  mutate(`AGED%` = (`AGED`/`TOTAL`)*100) %>% 
  filter(`AGED%` >=0)
var = get.var("AGED", mpszpop2020a)
boxbreaks(var)
## [1] -4330     0   515  2080  3745  8590 20240
boxmap("AGED",mpszpop2020a)
## Warning: Breaks contains positive and negative values. Better is to use
## diverging scale instead, or set auto.palette.mapping to FALSE.

var = get.var("AGED%", mpszpop2020a)
boxbreaks(var)
## [1] -2.17276  0.00000 11.28169 16.48199 20.25132 33.70576 95.00000
boxmap("AGED%",mpszpop2020a)
## Warning: Breaks contains positive and negative values. Better is to use
## diverging scale instead, or set auto.palette.mapping to FALSE.
